channel.title: [Project Insanity] Array needs to be extended [Project Insanity]
channel.description:
Hey MoparScapians,
[code=java] java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at Class36.methodCustomAnimations(Class36.java:63) at Animation.unpackConfig(Animation.java:2125) at Client.startUp(Client.java:7472) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:35) at Client.run(Client.java:4722) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
I'm receiving this error on Run, when I run my Project Insanity client. I believe this is in all Project Insanity clients.
I know where the errors are coming from;
[code=java] at Class36.methodCustomAnimations(Class36.java:63) at Animation.unpackConfig(Animation.java:2125) [/code]
I just don't know how to extend the array, can people please help. Not so good client sided.
Note: One of my friends say that the array needs to be extended, but I'm not sure how to do it. If you can just help me I would be so appreciative.
Thanks,
Skyro. ;)

item.title: [Project Insanity] Array needs to be extended [Project Insanity]
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Raise the number in the [ ]

Does it need to be anything specific, or anything?

This is Line 63 in Class36.java

if (class18.anIntArray342[i3] != 0) {

This is line 2125 in Animation.java

Class36.methodCustomAnimations(false, file);

In the array in Class36.java in the [] it is [i3]. So do I just change the 3 or I need to change the i3 to a different letter and number?

Not so good client side.

Read full topic
